meanings.definition: To dig or scoop out material from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist excavates ancient artifacts carefully.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew excavates the foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The dog excavates the backyard looking for buried treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity excavates the hidden truth in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The excavating machine roared as it dug deep into the soil.

meanings.definition: To uncover or expose by digging.
meanings.sent1: The detective excavates clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent2: The storm excavates buried debris, revealing old secrets.
meanings.sent3: The kids excavate the sandbox to find their lost toys.
meanings.sent4: Her questions excavate the buried emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The excavation of the ancient ruins brought history back to life.

meanings.definition: To remove earth or other material from a site.
meanings.sent1: The workers excavate the construction site to clear the land.
meanings.sent2: The miners excavate coal from deep underground.
meanings.sent3: The gardener excavates weeds to make space for new plants.
meanings.sent4: The river excavates the soil along its banks during heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The excavating truck hauls away the excess dirt from the excavation site.
